channel.title: How to find a download link for most flash games
channel.description:
I do realize that .Flair made a Tut on how to download swf files to your comp...but his way is to much work, delete all your offline content, go through your cookies...waste of time.
Alright first go to a game site something like [url=http://www.addictinggames.com/]http://www.addictinggames.com/[/url] is what I'm useing in this Tut.
Once there find a game you want to download. Example Bowman2 now right click on the picture or link to the game and click
"save target as.." for IE [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/internetexplor.jpg[/img]
for Firefox right click and click "save link as.." [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/firefox.jpg[/img]
save the file on your desktop, it'll be saved as a .html file now right click on the html file and "edit" notepad opens, [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/bowman.jpg[/img]
all you have to do now is use Ctrl + f (find) and search for swf you will then presented with something that looks like this: [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/link.jpg[/img]
Now all that I have highlighted is the download link for the game.
[edit] Now figure out a way to download it, aprently [i]people[/i] didn't like me useing flashget as an example, so I'm removeing the problem, use Firefox; veiw source of the page, I DON'T CARE. What I have done is shown you how to find the link in the .html file the rest is up to you. [/edit]
Once you have the game saved on your comp. Right click on the file click open with..choose program [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/open.jpg[/img]
Then check the box at the bottom "Always use the selected program to open this kind of file" then from the list choose an Internet browser. (Firefox, Internet Explorer etc, etc.) Click ok it then opens up a window in your browser, and tada! Game loaded, ready to play. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/with.jpg[/img]
You can delete the html file now.
DONE
creds: llib, photobucket lol ;)

item.title: How to find a download link for most flash games
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:14, topic:123200”][quote author=llib link=topic=172933.msg1603220#msg1603220 date=1184651261]
K again I say, I SUGGEST, SUGGEST, SUGGEST, SUGGEST, that you use a download manager. I assumed that once I showed you how to find the link to the game, you could figure out different ways to download it, aprently, I was wrong.

There I edited it and plain out said what I assumed just about everyone with a brain could do.
[/quote]

I hope you realize that most people on here have no brain.[/quote]

I do now. Thought Moparisthebest was better than MoparScape.

Read full topic

item.title: How to find a download link for most flash games
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

llib:

I save the webpage to desktop to get the link to the game, I used flashget as a suggestion I said use A download manager, not flashget. Although I posted on how to do it with flashget because thats what I use.

You could just as well view source to get the link; no downloading then deleting needed. You could use Firefox to download, rendering flashget useless.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

RXVL:

Lol, back when I used to use IE, I’d view the source, find the flash game, put the link on a freewebs site, then right click save target as. It’s much more easier.

Haha wtf. Just view it in Firefox then File > Save Page As…, aka Ctrl + S.

item.title: How to find a download link for most flash games
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

I do realize that .Flair made a Tut on how to download swf files to your comp…but his way is to much work, delete all your offline content, go through your cookies…waste of time.

Alright first go to a game site something like http://www.addictinggames.com/ is what I’m useing in this Tut.

Once there find a game you want to download. Example Bowman2 now right click on the picture or link to the game and click

“save target as…” for IE

internetexplor.jpg276×662

for Firefox right click and click “save link as…”

firefox.jpg319×800

save the file on your desktop, it’ll be saved as a .html file now right click on the html file and “edit” notepad opens,

bowman.jpg375×504

all you have to do now is use Ctrl + f (find) and search for swf you will then presented with something that looks like this:

link.jpg1037×894

Now all that I have highlighted is the download link for the game.

[edit]
Now figure out a way to download it, aprently people didn’t like me useing flashget as an example, so I’m removeing the problem, use Firefox; veiw source of the page, I DON’T CARE. What I have done is shown you how to find the link in the .html file the rest is up to you.
[/edit]

Once you have the game saved on your comp. Right click on the file click open with…choose program

Then check the box at the bottom “Always use the selected program to open this kind of file” then from the list choose an Internet browser. (Firefox, Internet Explorer etc, etc.) Click ok it then opens up a window in your browser, and tada! Game loaded, ready to play.

You can delete the html file now.

DONE
